meanings.definition: An ancient Roman festival in honor of Bacchus, characterized by drunken revelry.
meanings.sent1: The bacchanalia in the ancient Roman times were known for their wild parties.
meanings.sent2: The students threw a bacchanalia to celebrate the end of exams.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors complained about the noise coming from the bacchanalia next door.
meanings.sent4: The city streets turned into a bacchanalia of lights and music during the festival.
meanings.sent5: The bacchanalia at the wedding reception lasted until the early hours of the morning.

meanings.definition: A wild and drunken celebration or party.
meanings.sent1: The bacchanalia at the beach got a bit out of hand.
meanings.sent2: The New Year's Eve bacchanalia was the talk of the town.
meanings.sent3: The office party turned into a bacchanalia after the boss left.
meanings.sent4: The city erupted into a bacchanalia of joy after the sports team's victory.
meanings.sent5: The music festival turned into a bacchanalia of dancing and laughter.
